meanings.definition: A bishop who assists a diocesan bishop.
meanings.sent1: The suffragan supported the main bishop in leading the church.
meanings.sent2: The suffragan bishop helped the head bishop with church duties.
meanings.sent3: The suffragan bishop and the main bishop had a friendly competition in chess.
meanings.sent4: The suffragan bishop was like the trusted right hand of the diocesan bishop.
meanings.sent5: The suffragan's role was akin to the vice president in a company.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a suffragan bishop.
meanings.sent1: The suffragan attire was similar to that of the main bishop.
meanings.sent2: The suffragan duties were different from those of the head bishop.
meanings.sent3: The suffragan bishop's hat looked comically oversized on his head.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was suffragan, always supporting and assisting others.
meanings.sent5: The suffragan influence on decisions was subtle but significant.

meanings.sent1: The suffragan diocese was smaller but equally important.
meanings.sent2: The suffragan see had its own unique traditions.
meanings.sent3: In the suffragan diocese, the squirrels were rumored to hold secret meetings.
meanings.sent4: The suffragan see was like a close-knit community within the larger church.
meanings.sent5: The suffragan's diocese flourished under their caring leadership.
